data.title: UNPKG
data.text: 1# JSTS Topology Suite 23[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/bjornharrtell/jsts.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/bjornharrtell/jsts) 45The JSTS Topology Suite is a JavaScript library of spatial predicates and functions 6for processing geometry conforming to the Simple Features Specification for SQL published by 7the Open Geospatial Consortium. JSTS Topology Suite is also a JavaScript port of the well 8established Java library [JTS Topology Suite](http://tsusiatsoftware.net/jts/main.html) with 9a built in parser for OpenLayers geometries. 1011[SWECO Position AB](http://www.swecogroup.com/en/Sweco-group/Services/Geographical-IT/) (my current employer) has gratiously provided sponsoring for this project. 1213The primary goal of the project is to provide OpenLayers applications with a complete library for processing 14and analysing simple geometries, but as of version 0.11.0 hard dependencies to OpenLayers was removed 15which makes it possible to use JSTS Topology Suite as a free standing geometry library. 1617A [Google group](http://groups.google.com/group/jsts-devs) is available for developer discussions. 1819[Unit tests](http://bjornharrtell.github.com/jsts/test/SpecRunner.html) are made 20using the [Jasmine testing framework](https://github.com/pivotal/jasmine). A 21[port](http://bjornharrtell.github.com/jsts/validationsuite/index.html) of 22[JTS Validation Suite](http://www.vividsolutions.com/jts/tests/index.html) provides 23additional tests. 2425A "recent" trunk snapshot of [API docs is available](http://bjornharrtell.github.com/jsts/doc/api/index.html). Also 26available are simple example use of [buffer](http://bjornharrtell.github.com/jsts/examples/buffer.html), 27[overlay](http://bjornharrtell.github.com/jsts/examples/overlay.html) and [triangulation](http://bjornharrtell.github.com/jsts/examples/triangulation.html) 28operations. The examples uses a build of [attache-array-js](http://github.com/olooney/attache-array-js) to meet JavaScript ES5 requirements in some browsers. 29There are also some [examples of using JSTS with Node.js](https://github.com/bjornharrtell/jsts/tree/master/examples/nodejs). 3031## Development environment 3233* Eclipse 4.3.1 (Kepler) 35* Assumes OS Ubuntu/Linux 3637## Design changes 384041* Skip abstracted CoordinateSequence interface/implementation 4243## JSTS in use
